heading: HB00023
0: AN ACT STRENGTHENING THE ARCHITECTURE PROFESSION, AMENDING FOR THE PURPOSE CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF REPUBLIC ACT NUMBERED NINE THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED SIXTY-SIX (R.A. NO. 9266), OTHERWISE KNOWN AS THE "ARCHITECTURE ACT OF 2004"
status: Pending with the Committee on CIVIL SERVICE AND PROFESSIONAL REGULATION since 2016-07-26
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB00023
FULL TITLE : AN ACT STRENGTHENING THE ARCHITECTURE PROFESSION, AMENDING FOR THE PURPOSE CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF REPUBLIC ACT NUMBERED NINE THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED SIXTY-SIX (R.A. NO. 9266), OTHERWISE KNOWN AS THE "ARCHITECTURE ACT OF 2004"
ABSTRACT : Includes specific architectural terms in the Law that will distinguish the practice of architecture from other professions and require that architectural designs, plans and documents prepared exclusively and signed by an architect are required before any building permit may be issued.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : ABAYA, FRANCIS GERALD A.
DATE FILED : 2016-06-30
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
NATURE : Reform
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Sy-Alvarado (007 2016-08-08)2. Tambunting (000 2017-11-27)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON CIVIL SERVICE AND PROFESSIONAL REGULATION ON 2016-07-26
